```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(collapse = TRUE)
library(slumdown)
library(tidyverse)
```


The `slumdown` theme allows you to specify an image header, and a caption to be displayed over the top of the header image. The required lines for the YAML header are as follows:

```
header:
  caption: "A blank ggplot"
  image: 'header/theme_dark.png'
```

The image is scaled to fit but otherwise left as-is. I have been using images that are 1600x400 pixels in size as the headers. If no header image is specified in the YAML, then no header is used in the post.

For automatically generated pages (lists, the home page, the header is set using the relevant parameter in the `config.toml` file)
